messages.title: Why we're backing Richard
messages.content: Endorsements from local supporters Laura McDonald, Bert Donald, and Amy Murdie.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fight for a fair deal for NHS Grampian, reinvesting money raised from a mansion tax into more nursing courses.
Deliver a powerhouse Scottish Parliament with new powers to raise and create benefits, and full control over housing.
Freeze energy bills until 2017, ensuring families and businesses get a fairer deal on energy prices.
Scrap the bedroom tax which unfairly punishes disabled and vulnerable people.
Fight for more affordable housing in Aberdeen so that young people and families can have the security of a decent home and a good quality of life.

issues.health: Fight for a fair deal for NHS Grampian.

housing.content: Fight for more affordable housing in Aberdeen so that young people and families can have the security of a decent home and a good quality of life.

contactInformation.address: Ms Louise McElhinney, 78 Cairnfield Place, Aberdeen, AB16 5RJ

endorsements.endorsement: I've worked at NHS Grampian for over 30 years. Our patients need a properly funded NHS that isn't under extra pressure. Richard Baker's campaign is about his NHS Grampian pressure test, making sure that he is the best MP after May.

After years of Tory Government, I'm really worried that my grandchildren won't have the opportunities I had. Richard Baker will fight for good education, training, and jobs for young people. That's why I'm voting for Richard on May 7th.

One of my main concerns in this election is affordable housing. I know what it's like to pay a fortune in rent and see nothing change in your life. Aberdeen will never be able to solve its economic problems unless we solve our housing problem first. That's why I know Richard Baker wants real change and has brought the focus onto this issue. He'll fight hard for more affordable housing in Aberdeen.

images.caption: Richard Baker seated on Aberdeen's coastline.
